pdgm.pdgmnote: Kiessling1994 # 9.5.1. Das Negationssuffix -baɬi. Used also in nominal and adjectival predication. In nominal predication,-baɬi is preceded by predicative suffix –goo.

Kiessling1994 # 9.5.3. Der adjektivische Charakter des Negationssuffixes -baɬi. This is a nominal type negative construction. The adjectivally inflected baɬ comes inbetween the selector and the verbal noun form of the verb. Paradigm gives by way of example the second person forms.

Kiessling1994 # 9.7.1.1. Subject relative clause. (Head noun subject of relative.) Verb occurs In participial form (perf or imperf) – similar to relative clauses of ECush (cf. Somali). Sel formants are attahced to gender-marked subordinator:gu- masc.,da- fem.
Kiessling1994 9.6.1. Note that imprtv cannot occur in interrogative sentence,and thus never occur in non-reduced form. [So what is the meaning of these interr imprtv forms? - G.G.]
Kiessling1994 p. 132. [Shows common irregularities with Burunge]
Kiessling1994 # 7.1.1.2.8. [waar acts like a mixture of unmrkStem and nasalStem. comes from durative stem *waarim- (unattested in Burunge,but cf. ar- paradigm),reduced to *waam
Kiessling1994 5.6.1.2. Die deiktische anaphorische Basis. [The plural form serves also as a neuter. On deixis and reference features,cf. 5.5.1 and 5.5.2 (pp. 79-81).]

Kiessling1994 #7 (p. 122). The verb stem inflection consists of the following possible sequence:STEM - person - aspectMood - number - negation – interr. [The exclamation sign !is used by Kiessling as a morphophonemic indicator of (regressive or progressive) vowel shortening,and,when progressive,consonant devoicing. Cf. 4.1.11 (pp. 43f)]

Kiessling1994 # 9.5.3. Der adjektivische Charakter des Negationssuffixes -baɬi. The following paradigm illustrates the difference between the verbal suffix -baɬi,which gets reduced to –ba in the declarative,and the adjective baɬ,which undergoes no such reduction.
Kiessling1994 # 7.2.5.6. Das Paradigma fur Futur 1 lautet:
Kiessling1994 5.6.1.1 Die possessivische anaphorische Basis. [e.g.,(it is) mine,etc. (?)]

Kiessling1994 # 9.5.2. Der Prohibitiv. The prohibitive functions as the negation of the imprtv,subjunctive,and optative. Negation with -baɬi not possible. Instead,neg adv ħanti comes between selector and stem. The tnsAspMod is imperf;can be combined with any non-preterite tenseSel

Kiessling1994 #7.1.1.2 (p. 124). [The exclamation sign !is used by Kiessling as a morphophonemic indicator of (regressive or progressive) vowel shortening,and,when progressive,consonant devoicing. Cf. 4.1.11 (pp. 43f)]

Kiessling1994 #7 (p. 121). The preverbal selectorcomplex (Flexionskomplex) can contain morphemes from the following categories:clauseType - subjType - object - contrast - case - tenseAspect - sequential - actionOrientation
Kiessling1994 # 7.2.5.4. Das Beispielparadigma fur den Habitual lautet:
Kiessling1994 #7.1.1.2.5. Die Dentalobstrueten-Stamme. Paradigm followed by all extended stems with –id (continuative).
Kiessling1994 # 7.1.1.2.6 [No deletion of internal h when preceeded by long vowel.]
Kiessling1994 7.2.5.2. The imperf preterite needs a progressive durative stem.
Kiessling1994 # 9.6.1. Possessive suffixes also show reduction in declarative,non-reduction in interrogative
Kiessling1994 # 7.1.1.2.8 (Hypothetical base for actual waar- paradigm)
Kiessling1994 #7.1.1.2.5. Die Dentalobstrueten-Stamme. Paradigm followed by all extended stems with –id (continuative).

Kiessling1994 # 9.7.1.1. Subject relative clause. (Head noun subject of relative.) Verb occurs In participial form (perf or imperf) – similar to relative clauses of ECush (cf. Somali). Sel formants are attahced to gender-marked subordinator:gu- masc.,da- fem.

Kiessling1994 5.6.1.1 Fem. poss anaphoric pronoun is grammaticized,in conjunction with a locative case suffix as a reference switch indicator.

Kiessling1994 # 7.2.16. In the imprtv,applicative verbs do not have the prefix hil-,but suffix a kind of protemanteau morpheme. [Object indication not possible.]
Kiessling1994 # 7.2.5.3. Das Kompletivmorphem. Der imperfische Aspekt dagegen forert wuederum den progressivischem Verbalstamm:
Kiessling1994 # 7.2.16. Die folgenden Beispiele illustrieren die viergliedrige Opposition im Imperativ applikativischer Verbalstamme:
Kiessling1994 # 7.1.1.2.6 [No deletion of internal h when preceeded by long vowel.]
Kiessling1994 # 9.6.1. Die Satzfrage. Comparative list of morphological markers in declarative (with final reduction) and interrogative (without final reduction).

Kiessling1994 6.3 (pp. 93-109). Derived stem template:comitative - applicative - frequentative - ROOT - distributive - {progressive,intensive}- inchoative - durative - {mediopassive,continuative}- causative. The plural root (suppletive in a number of verbs) is often formed with a derived stem (frequentative,continuative,durative,progressivew,or intensive - cf. section 6.5.2,pp. 113 - 119. [The exclamation sign !is used by Kiessling as a morphophonemic indicator of (regressive or progressive) vowel shortening,and,when progressive,consonant devoicing. Cf. 4.1.11 (pp. 43f)]

prop.val: reduplication of root-final syllable with vowel lengthening
